bug.short_desc: Theme gives deprecation warnings when building with 1.4.1

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1004 Updated font theme file now compatible with qx 1.4.X
DarkTheme uses the deprecated qx.core.Settings method of gleaning on which OS it is being used (for the Fonts portion of the theme.)
These need to be updated to use qx.core.Environment. I updated the Fonts file accordingly and attached the new file here.
Another suggestion might be to tag the current "pre-1.4.X" version of the theme in the svn repo for users of older frameworks.
Thank you for an amazing theme. It's great!

Thanks for reporting this bug.
I've created a separate 0.1 branch of DarkTheme which is suitable for qx versions 1.0 to 1.3. Please use the trunk if you want to apply the theme to apps generated with qx v1.4 or above.

Thank you for the quick response.
I spoke too soon. It seems the changes to the theme system in 1.4.X are much larger than just the Font.js file. I ran the migration tool on the theme and the demo, but they are not working correctly. I apologize for not knowing more about the themeing capabilities to post the necessary updates.
As a matter of fact, your theme is so critical to my application I'll roll back to 1.3.1 for now. I have a deadline to meet for now, but when time is available I can try and take a look at what is necessary to update the theme.
Thank you, again, for donating your time and the theme to the community.

Wow! I really spoke too soon. It seems you have had a very busy weekend. I see you both posted a new very, very nice theme in Graydient as well as updated DarkTheme.
You are now on my list of favorite people. I know the effort to create these projects is not trivial. Thank you! Thank you!!!!
